entries.title: Watch: Greta Thunberg detained during coal mine protest
entries.description: Swedish climate activist Greta Thunberg was detained by German police alongside other activists during protests against the demolition of the German coal village of Luetzerath.

entries.title: Climate activist Greta Thunberg detained at coal mine protest
entries.description: German police detained famed environmental activist Greta Thunberg on Tuesday, according to footage of ongoing protests against a coal mine's expansion.

entries.title: E.U. pushes forward with ‘Green Deal Industrial Plan’ for clean tech
entries.description: European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen outlined her “Green Deal Industrial Plan” that aims to push through subsidies for green industries and boost funding for E.U. wide projects. The plan would help the E.U. pursue its goal of being climate neutral by 2050.

entries.title: E.U. outlines plan for clean tech future boosted by subsidies
entries.description: The European Union pushed forward on Tuesday with a major clean tech industrial plan which not only should keep the continent in the vanguard of plotting a

entries.title: Britain vows new law to ban conversion therapy for LGBTQ people
entries.description: Britain will seek to ban conversion therapy targeting lesbian, gay, bisexual and transgender people, cracking down on so-called treatments that claim to change

entries.title: Former Russian mercenary commander says he's seeking asylum in Norway after witnessing atrocities
entries.description: A former Wagner mercenary group commander who fought in Ukraine, Andrei Medvedev, said he is seeking asylum in Norway after fleeing Russia in fear for his life.

entries.title: China's first Lunar New Year without Covid restrictions fuels fears of a rural crisis
entries.description: China’s first Lunar New Year without Covid restrictions has fueled fears that travelers from virus-hit cities could infect family members in rural areas.

entries.title: Kevin Spacey celebrated in Italy at first major speaking event since sexual assault allegations
entries.description: Making his first speaking appearance since sexual assault allegations derailed his career, actor Kevin Spacey used a colorful Italian term to thank the National Cinema Museum in the northern city of Turin on Monday for inviting him.

entries.title: Former Wagner mercenary seeks asylum after witnessing atrocities
entries.description: Andrei Medvedev, a former commander in Russia's Wagner mercenary group who fought in Ukraine, said he is seeking asylum in Norway after claiming to have witnessed atrocities on the front line.

entries.title: Who is the Russian mercenary leaving his mark on the Ukrainian battlefield?
entries.description: As Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy calls on the West to speed up its weapons supplies, a Russian mercenary group is declaring victory in the small town of Soledar, Russia’s first battlefield victory for months. NBC News’ Matt Bradley reports from Kyiv.

entries.title: Norway archaeologists find 'world's oldest runestone'
entries.description: Archaeologists in Norway said Tuesday that have found a runestone which they claim is the world’s oldest, saying the inscriptions are up to 2,000 years old

entries.title: Kevin Spacey honored for lifetime achievement by Italian cinema
entries.description: Making his first speaking appearance since #MeToo-era allegations derailed his career, actor Kevin Spacey thanked Italy's National Cinema Museum for having the courage to invite him and his fans for standing by him.

entries.title: U.K. government to veto Scotland’s gender self-recognition law
entries.description: The British government said Monday it will block a new law that makes it easier for people in Scotland to legally change their gender.

entries.title: Australian Open bans flags from Russia, Belarus on site
entries.description: Flags from Russia and Belarus were banned from the site of the Australian Open on Tuesday after more than one was brought into the stands by spectators.

entries.title: U.K. using trans people as ‘political weapon,’ says Scotland’s first minister
entries.description: British Prime Minister Rishi Sunak is set to block a Scottish bill that would make it easier for people to change gender for legal purposed by self-declaration. Scotland’s First Minister Nicola Sturgeon criticized Sunak’s move, saying that the British government was using transgender people as a “political weapon.”

entries.title: President of Vietnam resigns after being blamed for officials’ wrongdoing
entries.description: Vietnamese President Nguyen Xuan Phuc resigned after the ruling Communist Party found him responsible for wrongdoing of officials under him, state media said.

entries.title: Ukrainians trying to clear land mines turn to Cambodia for help
entries.description: Ukrainians are being trained by experts in Cambodia whose experience removing land mines left over from decades of war has made them among the world’s best.

entries.title: China’s economy grew 3% in 2022, weighed down by Covid rules and property slump
entries.description: China reported GDP growth for 2022 that beat expectations as December retail sales came in far better than projected.

entries.title: China’s population declines for the first time in decades
entries.description: China said that its population had declined for the first time in decades, a historic shift with profound implications for the world’s second-largest economy.

entries.title: Italy’s most notorious fugitive Matteo Messina Denaro arrested
entries.description: Notorious mafia boss Matteo Messina Denaro, Italy’s most wanted fugitive, was led out of a private medical clinic in the Sicilian capital of Palermo in handcuffs. NBC News’ Kelly Cobiella has more details on the arrest after Denaro eluded police for three decades.

entries.title: Ukrainian rescue workers searching for missing people in Russian attack on Dnipro
entries.description: Ukrainian rescue workers are still sifting through rubble, desperate to find dozens of missing people more than two days after a devastating Russian attack on an apartment building in the central city of Dnipro. NBC News’ Matt Bradley has the latest on the conflict.

entries.title: All passengers in Nepal plane crash likely dead
entries.description: Investigators are trying to understand what brought Yeti Flight 691 down seconds before it was scheduled to land in Nepal. NBC News’ Molly Hunter has more details on the country’s deadliest aviation incident in decades.
